page.title: 09The School Day Begins. Clair
page.content: A teacher comes out into the playground and tells us to line up. Then we go in to the school row by row. In the cloakroom it is hard to do anything because people keep pushing and shoving. After I've hung up my coat and changed my shoes I get my stuff from my bag and try to untangle myself from the mess in the cloakroom. I move into the classroom and get out the books that I need. In comes Mrs. W. our teacher, who calls the register. The boys are called out first, followed by us girls. Then she says "Cardigans and pullovers removed and shoes removed." We line up for assembly. The boys always go in first. If someone is showing a play or a song and dance in assembly, we try to get to the back of the queue because we will then be nearer the front in the gym. 15 minutes later the school day begins.....
